name: FillStyle
description: Determines how texture coordinates are calculated Local Space:              Global Space: ┌─────────┐  ┌─────────┐  ┌─────────┐  ┌─────────┐ │ A   B   │  │ A   B   │  │ A...B   │  │ ...B... │ │         │  │         │  │         │  │         │ │ C   D   │  │ C   D   │  │ C...D   │  │ ...D... │ └─────────┘  └─────────┘  └─────────┘  └─────────┘ (Each shape   (Each shape  (Texture continues across gets full     gets full    shapes as if they're texture)      texture)     windows to same texture) / export type TextureSpace = /** 'local' - Texture coordinates are relative to the shape's bounds. The texture will stretch/fit to each individual shape's boundaries. Think of it like the shape having its own coordinate system. / | 'local' /** 'global' - Texture coordinates are in world space. The texture position is consistent across all shapes, as if the texture was laid down first and shapes were cut out of it. Think of it like wallpaper that shows through shaped holes. / | 'global'; /** Defines the style properties used for filling shapes in graphics and text operations. This interface provides options for colors, textures, patterns, and gradients. ```ts // Basic color fill const fillStyle = { color: 0xff0000,  // Red alpha: 0.5        // 50% opacity }; // Textured fill ( Graphics only ) const fillStyle = { texture: Texture.from('myImage.png'), matrix: new Matrix().scale(0.5, 0.5), }; // Gradient fill const gradient = new FillGradient({ end: { x: 1, y: 0 }, stops: [ { color: 0xff0000, offset: 0 }, // Red at start { color: 0x0000ff, offset: 1 }, // Blue at end ] }) const fillStyle = { fill: gradient, alpha: 1 }; ```

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color to use for the fill. This can be any valid color source, such as a hex value, a Color object, or a string. ```ts // Using a hex color const fillStyle = { color: 0xff0000 }; // Red // Using a Color object const fillStyle = { color: new Color(1, 0, 0) }; // Red // Using a string color const fillStyle = { color: 'red' }; // Red // Using object string const fillStyle = { color: 'rgb(255, 0, 0)' }; // Red ```

properties.name: alpha
properties.description: The alpha value to use for the fill. This value should be between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque). ```ts const fillStyle = { alpha: 0.5 }; // 50% opacity ```

properties.name: texture
properties.description: The texture to use for the fill. ```ts const fillStyle = { texture: Texture.from('myImage.png') }; ```

properties.name: matrix
properties.description: The transformation matrix to apply to the fill pattern or texture. Used to scale, rotate, translate, or skew the fill. ```ts // Scale and rotate a texture fill const fillStyle = { texture: Texture.from('myImage.png'), matrix: new Matrix() .scale(0.5, 0.5) .rotate(Math.PI / 4) }; ```

properties.name: fill
properties.description: The fill pattern or gradient to use. This can be either a FillPattern for repeating textures or a FillGradient for color transitions. ```ts // Using a gradient const gradient = new FillGradient({ end: { x: 1, y: 0 }, stops: [ { color: 0xff0000, offset: 0 }, // Red at start { color: 0x0000ff, offset: 1 }, // Blue at end ] }); const fillStyle = { fill: gradient, alpha: 0.8 }; // Using a pattern const pattern = new FillPattern( Texture.from('pattern.png'), 'repeat' // or 'no-repeat', 'repeat-x', 'repeat-y' ); const fillStyle = { fill: pattern }; ```

properties.name: textureSpace
properties.description: Determines how texture coordinates are calculated across shapes. - 'local': Texture coordinates are relative to each shape's bounds - 'global': Texture coordinates are in world space ```ts // Local space - texture fits each shape independently const fillStyle = { texture: Texture.from('myImage.png'), textureSpace: 'local' }; // Global space - texture continues across shapes const fillStyle = { texture: Texture.from('myImage.png'), textureSpace: 'global' }; ```

properties.name: width
properties.description: A stroke attribute object that defines how lines and shape outlines are drawn. Controls properties like width, alignment, line caps, joins, and more. ```ts const graphics = new Graphics(); // Basic stroke with width graphics.stroke({ width: 4, color: 0xff0000 // Or use a Color object }); // Stroke with rounded corners and ends const text = new Text('Hello World', { fontSize: 32, fill: 0x000000, // Text color stroke: { width: 8, color: 0x00ff00, // Or use a Color object cap: 'round',    // Round end caps join: 'round',   // Round corner joins alignment: 0.5   // Center alignment } }); // Stroke with mitered corners graphics.stroke({ width: 6, color: 0x0000ff, // Or use a Color object join: 'miter', miterLimit: 3,   // Limit how far miter extends alignment: 0     // Outside alignment }); // Pixel-perfect line graphics.stroke({ width: 1, pixelLine: true, // Ensures crisp 1px lines color: 0x000000  // Or use a Color object }); ``` / export interface StrokeAttributes { /** The width of the stroke in pixels. ```ts const stroke = { width: 4 }; ```

properties.name: alignment
properties.description: The alignment of the stroke relative to the path. - 1: Inside the shape - 0.5: Centered on the path (default) - 0: Outside the shape ```ts // Inside alignment const stroke = { alignment: 1 }; // Centered alignment const stroke = { alignment: 0.5 }; // Outside alignment const stroke = { alignment: 0 }; ```

properties.name: cap
properties.description: The style to use for the ends of open paths. - 'butt': Ends at path end - 'round': Rounds past path end - 'square': Squares past path end ```ts const stroke = { cap: 'round' }; ```

properties.name: join
properties.description: The style to use where paths connect. - 'miter': Sharp corner - 'round': Rounded corner - 'bevel': Beveled corner ```ts const stroke = { join: 'round' }; ```

properties.name: miterLimit
properties.description: Controls how far miter joins can extend. Only applies when join is 'miter'. Higher values allow sharper corners. ```ts const stroke = { join: 'miter', miterLimit: 3, }; ```

properties.name: pixelLine
properties.description: When true, ensures crisp 1px lines by aligning to pixel boundaries. > [!NOTE] Only available for Graphics fills. ```ts const graphics = new Graphics(); // Draw pixel-perfect line graphics .moveTo(50, 50) .lineTo(150, 50) .stroke({ width: 1, pixelLine: true, color: 0x000000 }); ```

properties.name: end
properties.type:
{ x: 1, y: 0 },
 *    stops: [
 *        { color: 0xff0000, offset: 0 }, // Red at start
 *        { color: 0x0000ff, offset: 1 }, // Blue at end
 *    ]
 * })

properties.name: fontSize

48,

 *         width: 4,
 *         color: 0x000000,
 *         alignment: 0  // Outside stroke
 *     }
 * })

properties.name: end

{ x: 1, y: 0 },

 *       { color: 0xff0000, offset: 0 }, // Red at start
 *       { color: 0x0000ff, offset: 1 }, // Blue at end
 *   ]

64,
